subject: Physical Fitness
title: Why Warm-Ups Matter
description: A quick win: understand Why Warm-Ups Matter.

hook.text: Jumping into hard exercise cold is like flooring a car in winter. Something is going to protest.

buildup.text: Cold muscles are stiff and less elastic. Cold joints have thicker synovial fluid. Movement feels heavy.

discovery.text: A warm-up raises muscle temperature by 1â€“2Â°C. That small change boosts power output by up to 10%.

twist.text: Static stretching before exercise weakens muscles temporarily. Dynamic movement is what works.

climax.text: The ideal warm-up mirrors your workout at lower intensity. Running? Walk first. Lifting? Start light.

punchline.text: Five minutes of warm-up buys better performance and fewer injuries.
